position.name: Copy of Junior Compliance and Immigrations Manager

jobDescription.name: Your mission
jobDescription.value:
The International Affairs Office Manager will ensure the provision of visa support to all registered laOlaWeb students as well as compliance with all necessary visa regulations as per German law. This position reports to the Head of Student Services and Deputy Head of Operations.
In this role you will take ownership of the visa support and compliance reporting provided by laOlaWeb. Your tasks and responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
• Being the central point of contact for all student enquiries and complaints related to student visa and compliance This includes information about visas, blocked bank accounts and health insurance, as well as working rights and post-graduate residency options.
• Managing BSBI’s existing partnership with SERS-RA GmbH, who provide immigration support services to students, and provide them with administrative support. Additionally, be a point of contact for partnerships with health insurance providers.
• Corresponding with German authorities
• Direct line management of Visa and Compliance/International Affairs Officers
• Driving the development of BSBI’s visa support services and creating the strategy needed to meet its objectives.
• Maintaining a comprehensive, up-to-date overview of students’ visa status to monitor compliance and ensure no student breaches visa regulations, taking action where needed.
• Reporting students who are have not complied with visa regulations, have been withdrawn from BSBI, or received a visa to Germany but never formally registered with the college to the Berlin visa authorities.
• Liaising with German embassies abroad upon request.
• Be actively involved in the registration process ensuring student visas are correct, checked and uploaded into the student database in a timely fashion.
• Assist in visa-related webinars.

jobDescription.name: Your profile
jobDescription.value:
ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:
• Attention to detail is a must in this position
• Previous work experience in an administrative position
• Previous work experience in customer service
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills
• Excellent organisational skills
• Excellent language skills in English
• Native or near-native level of German

Desired skills:
• Previous experience in working with visa matters, German immigration offices and/or lawyers
• Previous managerial experience

jobDescription.name: Why us?
jobDescription.value: laOlaWeb’s mission is to educate students to effectively shape the future and become excellent leaders of tomorrow in an ever-changing business world. It also aims to teach students to understand how businesses function and how economic success is generated. laOlaWeb offers industry-relevant programs that focus on the development of practical entrepreneurial skills necessary for professional success. Located in the heart of Berlin, we are an international business school that offers academic excellence. We are a member of Global University Systems (GUS) and provide unlimited career opportunities for its students and staff.

In this role you will take ownership of the visa support and compliance reporting provided by laOlaWeb. Your tasks and responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

jobDescription.name: Your mission
jobDescription.value:
About the job
laOlaWeb's mission is to educate students to effectively shape the future and become excellent leaders of tomorrow in an ever-changing business world.

It also aims to teach students to understand how businesses function and how economic success is generated.

laOlaWeb offers industry-relevant programs that focus on the development of practical entrepreneurial skills necessary for professional success.

Located in the heart of Berlin and with campuses in Paris, Barcelona, Hamburg and Athens, we are an international business school that offers academic excellence, is a member of Global University Systems (GUS) and provides unlimited career opportunities for its students and staff.

jobDescription.name: Weiterer Text
jobDescription.value:
Programme Advisors are responsible for promoting programme portfolio to potential students via phone, e-mail and online meetings, forming a vital and integral part of the sales team. The purpose of the role is to manage the pipeline of students from initial application right through to payment of tuition fees, offering international students support through the entire application process.

You will work with minimal day-to-day supervision, leading on and managing the consultative sales process within established parameters and procedures. They will require a thorough understanding of relevant systems/processes, BSBI products, or the working environment. Role holders will strive to achieve set targets, and organise their own day-to-day work to meet clear objectives.

Independence and initiative will be required to react to changing priorities and work circumstances, with the scope to make decisions within clear parameters and contribute actively to improving processes.

jobDescription.name: Your profile
jobDescription.value:
Providing individually tailored advice to all prospective students, adapting to different communication styles
• Consulting students through the full application circle: from initial conversation through to finalising and closing their application to study
• Exploring possible career paths for students and assertively matching them with specific BSBI offerings
• For international students: advising / making students aware of visa, immigration issues and compliance
• Handling student enquiries regarding different programmes and adapting to different communication needs
• Proven track record of cultivating meaningful client relationships and delivering tailored solutions
• Providing outstanding customer service to all students and all stakeholders, in a timely and efficient manner, and encouraging students to choose laOlaWeb
• Portraying a positive and professional image of aOlaWeb at all times.
• Account Managing students’ applications from initial enquiry up to payment of tuition fees and registration
• Leveraging available technology and keeping all records up to date
• Correct and time-efficient management of leads pipeline

jobDescription.name: Your mission
jobDescription.value:
General administrative duties (maintaining databases, issuing official university letters, etc.)
• Offering support in preparation for and throughout the registration process
• Delivering the highest levels of customer satisfaction through seamless administration, excellent customer service, and effective communication
• Work collaboratively with (international) partners, executing regulations and schedules
• Monitor students’ performance and attendance in their program
• Organise timetables and schedules
• Manage teaching modules´ materials online and offline / information management
• Work effectively with a diverse range of service providers and colleagues
• Manage any other tasks given from time to time by the senior management

jobDescription.name: Your profile
jobDescription.value:
A minimum of a Bachelor´s degree (or equivalent)
• High level of customer focus and excellent attention to detail, first-rate organisational skills
• Proficiency with MS Office suite
• High level of discretion, diplomacy, and cultural intelligence
• Enjoy working in a team
• Flexible mindset and ability to adapt to different responsibilities
• Fluency in English
• Experience in working, living, or studying abroad or with international audiences

Preferred qualifications:
Proven track record in the areas of academic affairs, student services, enrolment management, continuing education, program development, and administration
• Demonstrated ability to develop new approaches, solutions, and methods solutions
• Additional languages skills
